name: Geovillage Sport Wellness & Convention Resort

reviews.text: I stayed at Geovillage with my family for two nights in order to bridge the days between the flights that were available and our house rental on Sardinia. Overall this is a nice hotel somewhere in the four star category with the according amenities. It is located outside of Olbia, about a 15 minute drive from the airport. There is no beach access, but a beach shuttle available.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but some service flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check-in was a total drag and took forever. Tough the reception staff tried to be friendly, it was apparent that they were overly stressed and had to deal with time consuming complaints.
reviews.title: excellent promo offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice, modern and fairly clean. The hallways seemed a bit untidy though. The amenities in the room offered basic comfort, but we encountered and issue with one of the sinks in the bathroom. The bedding was comfortable and offered a good night sleep.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.text: As we joined the dinner buffet quite late it was a bit grazed off. The quality of the food was decent and the service was very nice. The breakfast buffet was very crowded and the overall selection sufficient but a bit sparse. Service was also not that great and the coffee machine also ended up not being functional.
reviews.title: beautiful holidays

reviews.text: The Geovillage offers a lot of sports and has a very nice pool with music and entertainment. They also have an a la carte restaurant with basic Italian dishes, which were good in quality and the service provided was friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel mostly for the swimming facilities, the outdoor 50m pool was great and never very busy. The indoor 25m and 20m pools they advertise were empty. Our first room was at the top of a steep hill and was ok until the second night when after a bath the water came back through the shower, and flooded the bathroom with sewage. Reception staff were not interested, did nothing that night and only after speaking to the manager did we get moved the next day to rooms in the main hotel. These rooms were much better looked after. Three out of four of us ended up with a stomach bug, not sure why...
reviews.title: Glad to be home...

reviews.text: The organisation at the hotel was poor - never any cups or knives at breakfast, no information pack on what time anything was open, the wifi didn't work a lot of the time, the spa was quite dirty and cold and a lot of the outside areas looked really shabby.
reviews.title: Aweful reception, noisy swimming pool

reviews.text: The final straw was our hire car being vandalised in the car park- someone snapped off the windscreen wipers....
reviews.title: Shambles from start to finish

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for day-use waiting for a boat charter but what the hotel charged us turned out to be the full bed and breakfast price. It made us feel cheated.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I have to report a very loud music the swimming pool which will not please every travelor and very lousy reception staff. It took us twice one hour to check in and out. Aweful!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: with the family we were staying at this hotel for 6 nights. Room was clean, bed spaciuos, nice hotel territory, many of tennis courts to play, quite large swiming pool. But all the good things are drown by bad kitchen (poor and the same limited meals during the breakfast, with permanent shoratges, very costly and tasteless dinners (for the less price you can have a better meal in Olbia town usual pizzeria/restaurante). Hotel is not worth 4 stars at all.
reviews.title: nice territory, rooms, but poor staff and kitchen

reviews.text: I was at this hotel for a football tournament. Its sport facilities are quite good from what I could experience. Unfortunately, in other aspects it was quite a disappointment: poor food quality, tropical temperature in the restaurant (no air), internet did not work, the shower has no support for the tap (one needs to hold it himself), one bed cover was missing..
reviews.title: Not a 4 stars hotel

reviews.text: This was a very disappointing experience. If we had wanted to stay in the room the whole time without wanting to eat, it would have been fine - the rooms were clean and spacious and the beds huge and comfortable. However, we had wanted a spa break with delicious food and treatments. Forget it. Never seen such an unappetising dinner buffet - all cold even the meat and potatoes. Breakfast buffet was even worse with almost raw fatty bacon, congealed scrambled eggs, stale bread and croissants, hot drinks machine with cheap bitter coffee (in Italy!). The Spa pool was cold and many pieces of equipment were broken and dangerous. The pizzeria/a la carte restaurant had no atmosphere (and no pizzas at lunchtime), one surly waiter and strange choices of food - beware the item titled 'Grand Prix' as this translates to 'slice of horse'. As I said, book elsewhere.
reviews.title: Book Elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was almost impossible to find, it doesn't have a road name and the address given just gives you the area. It took us over 1 hour to find it, driving round, and round and round.................. There are very few signs to the hotel. We even went to the Mecure Hotel in Olbia and they told us which direction to drive in, and they confirmed there was no road name.
reviews.title: needle in a haystack!

reviews.text: Once we got there finally, they had no confirmation of our booking!! it was only the fact that I had a copy of my booking that they found a room for us.
reviews.title: For Value and Service look here first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very odd place. We were looking for a spa/hotel in Olbia to wind up a trip to Sardinia and on the surface this place looked great. The reception staff were very friendly, the prices were reasonable, the rooms were spacious and clean, and there are lots of dining and fitness/relaxing options, however the reality once we'd checked in was quite different.
reviews.title: Beware of this place – slice of horse, anyone?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was not kept very clean. There was a charge for towels or bathrobes. The temperature of the water was too cold. Many of the hydromassage jets and sprays in the pool and surrounding areas were broken. There were supposed to be four metal beds submerged in the water around which water would bubble. Only one worked. Alarmingly one was just a jagged pipe sticking submerged in the shallow end which people could easily not see but injure themselves on. The staff said all would be fixed by the next day, but no effort had been made to do so.
reviews.title: Geovillage Hotel, Olbia no more no less

reviews.text: The "a la carte" restaurant was understaffed and offered dismal food, with a menu worse than the photo attached would indicate. "Slice of horse", anyone?! The mozzarella starter was the worst I have ever tasted in 25 years of regularly visiting Italy. I asked for the spaghetti with clams and baby tomatoes and was instead offered spaghetti with mussels and some kind of sausage: I had the wisdom to decline this immediately.
reviews.title: Swimmin pools versus location

reviews.text: In a separate brightly lit hall the "buffet" reminded me of the worst school dinners - simply atrocious. Tired salads, stale bread, trays of tepid unappetising food... This was at dinner. Breakfast was if anything worse, with sickening trays of scrambled egg and nasty bacon. When a friend asked for a boiled egg, it was as if he'd asked the kitchen to invent the chicken. Half an hour later a tray of boiled eggs materialised which the hall of punters descended upon liked deprived inmates.
reviews.title: not to choose

reviews.text: The free WiFi was infuriatingly sporadic - ie failing almost by the minute. The car park was a treacherous slalom course. The cocktail bar rarely had the right ingredients to make any of the drinks on the menu.
reviews.title: Very good place

aka: Geovillage Sport Wellness & Convention Resort Olbia, Sardinia
